milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.title: Add a way to run components at design time in the editor
data.body:
Could we please have an [EditorMode] decorator or some such to allow us to write code in components that will run in the editor?

In theory we can now create components in javascript, typescript and C# that can have properties exposed in the editor with the awesome inspector fields. We can assign images to scripts and have sliders to edit numbers etc... all we're missing from being able to use that to make a ton of different tools and plugins is a way for that component to be initialized and updated at design time, inside the editor.

This shows the sort of thing I mean: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6dnQX0ChOsA

data.title: Select dll and class on CSComponent from drop down
data.body:
Instead of the JSComponent workflow of selecting Logic->CSComponent and populating the class (and dll), add a sublist for each dll to the component list. Add components under their respective dlls. So:
AddComponent->List->MyLib->MyComponent

data.title: Fix issue #480 Allow the camera to rotate in the scene view infinitely
data.body: Right click on viewport will hide the cursor and allow the camera to continue to rotate. Fix issue #480

data.title: CSComponent work and sender specific events
Test
Add C# support for adding an event handler to a specific Object
Adding C# component FixedUpdate and PostUpdate, ScriptPhysics for NodeCollision and contacts
Fix linux crash on player exit
data.body: This pr fixes the editor crash when the player is exited. It was tracked down to an optimization issue with g++ -O3 and VectorBuffer::Write() in a particular situation. This call was changed to VectorBuffer::SetData(), which will perform the same action for filling a new VectorBuffer, and does not incur the -O3 optimization problem.

data.title: C# support for Vector/PODVector of RefCounted return and parameter values, C# support for method overloading
data.body: This PR also introduces specific skip methods for different language bindings

data.title: AtomicNET support for OSX/Linux including Xamarin Studio integration
Linux Package for Atomic Game Engine
data.body:
Create a linux package of the Atomic Game engine.

Create Build/CIScripts/GenLinuxEditor.js to compile and assemble the package
Tthe target format for the package is .deb
The media is deployed into /usr/share and the binaries in /opt with links in /usr/bin

data.title: The scrollbar in the code editor fails if your mouse moves outside of the scrollbar

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
on Windows platform -

If your mouse ever goes off of _the scrollbar_ while scrolling, the scroll fails.
It makes the scrollbar almost impossible to use.

I don't want to move my hand straight up and down like a robot out of fear of touching the edge of the scrollbar when simply trying to scroll.

The same issue applies when trying to select lines in the gutter.

data.body: This looks like it may be a general issue with methods involving collections, none of the other methods that take or return Vector<> or PODVector are exposed either

data.title: Update to latest version of TypeDoc
data.body:
The issue that wasn't allowing the TypeDoc documentation to be generated with a custom theme has been resolved ( https://github.com/TypeStrong/typedoc/issues/227 ) 

This change does the following
- Allows for the latest TypeDoc to be pulled which uses the latest TypeScript
- adds a fix for the latest NPM so that the node_modules get put in the right place

data.title: Add joystick cursor control
data.body:
This PR adds 2 functions which will allow the joystick/game controller the ability to move the mouse cursor and do a mouse button click. With these, you can operate most of the UI controls, and operate the game completely from the joystick.  
I'll "fix" space game with this ability, in addition to playing the game.

data.title: Atomic.d.ts updates
data.body:
Some updates to the Atomic.d.ts
- fixed node.getComponent<T> definition to match the actual signature of node.getComponent
- exposed node.getParentComponent<T>
- added Type definition for Ray
- added Type definition for RayQueryResult
- exposed Camera.getScreenRay
- exposed Octree.rayCastSingle
- exposed Octree.rayCast

data.title: Update JSComponent to used SharedPtr
NFD file dialogs no longer remember the last path chosen for common operations
data.body:
In adding defaults path, common file dialogs no longer remember the last path chosen (which is OS level), the default should probably only be applied the first time, otherwise whenever choosing a project, etc, you have to navigate from the default.  

https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/commit/e976f341fd28c4b45251e3ad069bdfeadbc8800f

data.title: Script lifetime improvements, fixes for recent update
data.body:
This is a pretty major update to JS object lifetime, which cleans up a number of systems most notably UI widgets and Nodes  I have tested with existing projects and examined lifetime using the new JSVM:: DumpJavascriptObjects() method.  Though, script lifetimes are tricky and there are likely bugs which will need fixing.

There are a number of bugs also addressed with the recent Urho 1.6 update.

data.title: Joystick Rumble support 954
data.body:
This PR adds rumble support for joysticks and game controllers. It also enables user configuration of unhandled game controllers to make them behave in a standardized way.
The rumble support is self initializing, the user does not have to make any calls to use the rumble. There is one convenience call to ask if rumble is supported on the joystick/controller. The main call is :
void JoystickRumble(unsigned int id, float strength, unsigned int length); /// produce rumble
    The id argument is what gets passed into the event handlers as the JoystickId, not the index, though they are often the same.
    The strength argument is a float from 0.0 to 1.0 and is the magnitude of the rumble event.
    The length argument is the number of milliseconds to play the rumble event.

The test program and example usage are delayed until the joystick event handlers stabilize.
